item.title: Need an experianced programmer!
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Create an array from the contents of a folder, then loop through and echo each item to the page, example from a project of mine:

$images = glob('images/slideshow/*.jpg');
$length = count($images);
for ($i = 0; $i < $length; $i++) {
      echo '<li><img src="' . $images[$i] . '" alt="" /></li>';
}

Iirc you can also change the glob function to read numerous file types like this for example:

$images = glob('images/slideshow/*.{jpg,gif,png,bmp}');

Then the displaying/styling part is down to you, it really depends how you want it formatted. Whether you want it in a slideshow format, clickable popout images, or just all displayed.

Check out some of the links below:
TinyFader - A simple to use JavaScript slideshow plugin. Though it’s a slideshow, you can modify the options slightly so that the pagination buttons are thumbnails, and it does not auto play. Can be easily styled to look like a gallery, is what I’m getting at.
FancyBox - Simple popout images, I have used this example here: charliegilmanuk.com/Alice/site/gallery.php
